title: Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentation of collaborative research on analyzing political discourse using large language models in hyperpartisan Facebook groups at the International Seminar on Disinformation, Social Media, and Climate (Porto Alegre, October 9–10, 2025). He also moderated a roundtable discussion on data access at another event.
description: This article reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentation on analyzing political discourse using large language models and his moderation of a roundtable discussion, both relating to disinformation and social media research.

title: Meet the speakers! - EUDTP 2025 - EuroTech Universities Alliance
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a Professor of Internet Studies at University of Urbino Carlo Bo and a speaker at the EUDTP 2025 conference. His research focuses on disinformation dynamics and computational methods for detecting manipulation campaigns.
description: This article from the EuroTech Universities Alliance announces Fabio Giglietto as a speaker at the EUDTP 2025 conference. It explicitly states his affiliation as a Professor of Internet Studies at University of Urbino Carlo Bo and mentions his research focus on disinformation dynamics and computational methods for detecting manipulation campaigns.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, is interviewed about his research on how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior, with a focus on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy.
description: This is a podcast interview with Fabio Giglietto, associate professor at the University of Urbino, discussing his research on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy and how actors respond to social media platforms' content moderation efforts.

title: Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a speaker at the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference.
description: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a speaker at the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference hosted by the University of Urbino. The conference topic is directly relevant to his expertise in social media analysis and disinformation detection.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Facebook premia gli estremisti: la ricerca dell'Università di Urbino - Lumsanews
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - ilducato.it
Insights and Report from the Coordinated Sharing Behavior Detection Conference - Vera.ai
snippet: Fabio Giglietto and Giada Marino presented insights from the vera.ai Alerts project, which tracked and analyzed coordinated accounts on Facebook, focusing on coordinated posts, links, and accounts with activity in various groups.
description: This article discusses a conference on coordinated sharing behavior detection and mentions Fabio Giglietto and Giada Marino presenting insights from the vera.ai Alerts project, which analyzed coordinated activity on Facebook.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: Fabio Giglietto leads the Uniurb team within the vera.ai project, coordinating Work Package 4 (WP4). The team focuses on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article introduces the team from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo involved in the vera.ai project, specifically mentioning Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the team coordinating Work Package 4, which focuses on detecting potentially problematic content in near-real-time.
